review: I love Fire TV, but was a little disappointed with the amount of Channels vs Roku Channel's. There seems to be more Roku channels.  The games are sufficient, as opposed to not that many games on  Roku.  I'm nearly 60 years old and do get bored and play games, if I can get them to work with the game controller. LOL!!!!  Maybe someone should video my confusion with that......HA!!!!!  I play a ton of Tower Defense games.  Strategy seems to be more my thing.......as long as they're Free and, if I can find them.  The movies are great, but I already have Netflix.  And to have to purchase Prime to get the full benefit of Fire TV, seemed a little bit redudant, and expensive to me, but hey........ What do I know?!?!?  I'm an old man that's just trying to stay tech savvy!!  (((Which sometimes is a big "FAIL!!!!")))  I don't have kids so games, unless they are the type that I  specifically like.....maybe someone should check into that.  (((???)))  Thanks for the opportunity to vent a little bit about this.
author: Donnie

review: Player works great with streaming content.  No Problems.  I like the little remote, hope I do not lose it.  -BUT-  The USB port is for a game controller or something only.  The player will not play photos or videos from the USB.  I was very disappointed.  You can upload files to amazon and play them, but only up to 20 min video files, and uploading is a real pain.
